arts.ttl: Bradford into top three as Calum Kavanagh seals win over Morecambe
arts.sum: The Bantams have won their last six home games.

arts.ttl: Police investigate social media post about Bradford City stadium fire that left 56 people dead
arts.sum: The fire which claimed the lives of 56 spectators, two of them visiting fans, broke out in one of the wooden stands at Valley Parade on May 11, 1985 during a third division clash with Lincoln

Bradford's 3-0 win over league leaders Walsall at the weekend was their fourth successive win and made it eight wins in their last 10. Morecambe's defeat to Colchester was their eighth defeat in thei...

arts.ttl: ‘Let’s see” – Bradford City transfer update shared by Graham Alexander
arts.sum: Bradford City boss Graham Alexander has refused to rule out further additions to his squad this winter. Bradford… The post ‘Let’s see” – Bradford City transfer update shared by Graham Alexander appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Morecambe boss Derek Adams on defeat at Colchester United
arts.sum: Mandela Egbo's second-half strike condemned Morecambe to defeat and Adams did not agree with referee Sam Purkiss's decision to show Angol the red card. “It gives them a huge advantage – last time, we went on to win the game, this time we didn’t and Colchester scored with a deflected goal and we really contained them.
